articles.title: Italian President Reiterates Stand for Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Italian President Reiterates Stand for Development of Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- It is the consistent stand of the Italian government to invariably develop relations with the DPRK. Giorgio Napolitano, president of Italy, said this on June 19 when he received credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Kim Chun Guk.
					 The president said he was satisfied with the bilateral relations that have developed on good term in the political, economic, cultural and other fields.
					
					 Peace in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula is an issue of great interest to the Italian government, he said, hoping the DPRK would make positive efforts for the regional security in the future, too.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The first secretary of the Committee handed the gift over to the DPRK consul general in Nakhodka on June 9.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung left here Saturday to visit Russia.
					 A delegation of the Christian Democratic People's Party of Switzerland led by Rene Imoberdorf, member of the Council of States from the party, arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Trounces Its Thai Rival 4-2
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Trounces Its Thai Rival 4-2
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team trounced its Thai rival 4-2 at the preliminary match for the AFC U-22 Championship on June 23.
					 Belonging to Preliminary Group F are the teams of the DPRK, China, Hong Kong of China, Thailand, Laos and Cambodia.
					
					 The DPRK team will play its second match with the Lao team on June 25.

articles.title: Senior Party and State Officials Visit Industrial Art Exhibition
articles.content:
Senior Party and State Officials Visit Industrial Art Exhibition
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly who is a member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and other senior party and state officials visited the State Industrial Art Exhibition on Friday.
					 The visitors were briefed on the State Industrial Art Centre that was built to suit to the modern tastes and the requirement of the times thanks to the care of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They looked around more than 1 700 designs and materials of various kinds displayed on the first floor of the exhibition hall, looking back on the exploits of great persons of Mt. Paektu for the development of the state industrial art. 
					
					 They also went round over 1 000 designs and goods of diverse kinds displayed on the second floor of the exhibition hall which was visited by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Visitors admired the valuable designs presented by industrial art creators and fans from across the country.

articles.title: Pyongyangites Volunteer to Help Builders of Ryugyong Health Complex
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Volunteer to Help Builders of Ryugyong Health Complex
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Ryugyong Health Complex now under construction by soldier builders on the bank of the River Taedong is nearing completion.
					 Many Pyongyang citizens have volunteered to help builders of the complex.
					
					 Jang Ok Sun, a worker at the Pyongyang Railway Bureau, told KCNA:
					
					 "The solider-builders here decorated sauna rooms with pinecones and pieces of pine trees. I was deeply moved to hear that they walled the rooms with stalactites in natural cavern and bricks of Kumgang medical stones good for health.
					
					 So I come here with my fellow workers from work to help the soldier-builders in grinding saunas.
					
					  A turtle is depicted on the sauna floor. This could be designed only by the soldier-builders serving the people."
					
					 Kim Il Bong, an artist at the Korean April 26 Children's Film Studio, said:
					
					 "I am a football fan. Nowadays, the Euro 2012 is broadcast on TV in the evenings. But, I come here to give a helping hand to the solider-builders.
					
					 The day is coming nearer when the complex will open with the loving care of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un for the people."
					
					 Pak Pong Sik, an officer of the Korean People's Army, said:
					
					 "The number of volunteers is on the increase with each passing day.
					
					 They are much touched by Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people. During his recent inspection of the construction project, Kim Jong Un expressed satisfaction over the construction, calling upon the soldier builders to do their best to finish it on the highest level."

articles.title: New Residents in Changjon Street Thankful for Socialist System
articles.content:
New Residents in Changjon Street Thankful for Socialist System
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- People have begun to move to new houses in Changjon Street in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					 New arrivals are very satisfied with their large and fashionable houses.
					
					 Jo Pok Nam, a worker at the Pyongyang Wood-processing Factory, told KCNA:
					
					 "It is really like a dream. I keenly feel grateful to our socialist system which grants such nice houses free of charge.
					
					 I will do my best for the prosperity of the country."
					
					 Pak Pong Nyo, a war veteran, said:
					
					 "I already received new houses from the State several times. But this modern house was offered to my family again.
					
					 Such favor will never be expected in capitalist society where money is everything.
					
					 I think it is only our country that gives priority to ordinary working people."
					
					 Nam Sung Guk, a section chief of the Overseas Construction Guidance Bureau, said:
					
					 "House prices are on the steady rise in Western capitalist countries. In the United States, an average price for a flat now stands at around 177 000 dollars. So many people are homeless.
					
					 This fact makes me feel the advantages of our socialist system.
					
					 I will devote myself to carrying into practice the noble intention of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is working heart and soul to provide the people with good living conditions and turn Pyongyang into a world-class city."

articles.title: Pyongyang Citizens Move into New Houses in Changjon Street
articles.content:
Pyongyang Citizens Move into New Houses in Changjon Street
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Changjon Street, newly built in the heart of Pyongyang, is now seethed with removal to new houses.
					 The street lined with high-rises is now crowded with newcomers.
					
					 Each house in Blocks Nos. 12 and 8 is thrice or quadruple as big as the old house.
					
					 On the 45th floor, one can command a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang city including Rungna Islet, the River Taedong and Moran Hill.
					
					 Kim Song Ho, a worker at the Central Heat Supply Network Company, told KCNA:
					
					 "The State gave us, workers' family, this nice house free of charge.
					
					 All my family members are determined to work harder to repay the benefit granted by the State."
					
					 Ri Pok Nyo, wife of Ri Sang Chol who is a worker at the Capital City Passenger Traffic Guidance Bureau, shed tears of emotion when looking round living rooms, kitchen, bathroom and store built on the highest level.  The home where all the Korean people live together is just the loving care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, she said.
					
					 Choe Hung Nam, a worker at the Tonggu Public Building Construction Company, said:
					
					 "I like my job. I feel high honor of being a worker in the socialist system which provides everyone with genuine rights on an equal footing. I and all others owe so much to our socialist system."

articles.title: Schoolchildren from Cho Island Enjoys Camping in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Schoolchildren from Cho Island Enjoys Camping in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren from Cho Island spent pleasant days at the Mangyongdae Children's Camp in Pyongyang.
					 They arrived in Pyongyang on June 16. They visited a room dedicated to the history of the camp associated with the loving care of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who made sure that the camp was built in picturesque Mt. Ryongak and the Ryongaksan Revolutionary Museum.
					
					 They enjoyed boating, mountaineering, sports and amusement games, training their body and mind.
					
					 They had a discussion on the writings done by them, poem reciting and a joint art performance with schoolchildren in Pyongyang. At these events they spoke of their great happiness of receiving the profound loving care and blessings from the Songun brilliant commander.
					
					 Their pleasant camping was followed by tour of different places of Pyongyang.
					
					 They visited President Kim Il Sung's old home in Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, etc. They went round Changjon Street.
					
					 They spent pleasant time at the Central Zoo, seeing animals' skills and observing rare animals.
					
					 They had real taste of Pyongyang cold noodle at Okryu and Chongryu restaurants.
					
					 Employees and officials of the Amusement Park in the Kaesong Youth Park and the Changgwang Health Complex showed all sincerity for them.
					
					 Schoolchildren from Cho Island left Pyongyang Saturday amid warm farewell of the officials and employees of the camp, carrying with them unforgettable memories of their pleasant camping.

articles.title: DPRK People Enjoy Worthwhile Working Life
articles.content:
DPRK People Enjoy Worthwhile Working Life
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- It has been 66 years since President Kim Il Sung promulgated "Labor Law for the Workers and Office Employees in North Korea" on June 24, Juche 35 (1946).
					 The promulgation made it possible for the working people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to have genuine rights and freedom of labor.
					
					 Under this law, the workers and office employees are granted the democratic rights in all respects such as eight-hour working system, paid leave system and social insurance system.
					
					 Kim Il Sung saw to it that popular labor policies were adopted one after another in the country, including the Cabinet decisions on enforcing the universal free medical care system, improving the living conditions of workers, engineers and office employees at state bodies, social cooperative organizations and industrial establishments and reducing the labor hours for working mothers.
					
					 On Apr. 18, 1978, the Socialist Labor Law was enacted to stipulate on a full scale all the requirements and regulations of the working life on the principle of strictly protecting the rights and interests of the working masses.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il had made every possible effort to let the people fully enjoy the worthwhile working and cultural life under the labor policies for the promotion of their well-being.
					
					 With this loving care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il kept in their mind, the Korean people have made great achievements in production and construction.
					
					 The DPRK is turning into a thriving socialist country by the patriotic and devoted efforts of the working masses.

articles.title: Drought Severely Affects North Hwanghae Province, DPRK
articles.content:
Drought Severely Affects North Hwanghae Province, DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Damage from lingering dry weather is growing in North Hwanghae Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to data available, nearly 20 000 hectares of farmland have been parched, as of June 23, and crops are withering away in the province.
					
					 Particularly, Hwangju County, a major granary of the province, has been severely affected by a long spell of drought.
					
					 Hwangbo Son Nyo, an old woman living in Koyon-ri, told KCNA that she had never witnessed such dry weather in the area for 70 years.
					
					 Ri Sun Pom, chairman of the County Rural Economy Committee, said: 
					
					 "It is hard to expect harvest in more than 2 000 hectares of corn-fields across the County though seeds were sowed thrice."
					
					 Pak Tok Gwan, management board chairman of the Ryongchon Co-op Farm, said that cornstalks are now only 40-70 centimeters high.
					
					 Paek Yong Chol, management board chairman of the Koyon Co-op Farm, said, "If the drought continues, corns can not but be cut off to be replaced by other crops."
					
					 Most of reservoirs in the county has gone dry and some paddy fields still remain unsown for lack of water.
					
					 This situation hinders the smooth supply of food to the residents.
					
					 At present the county is striving to minimize the drought damage with the active help of servicepersons, officials of ministries and national institutions and other people.

articles.title: Damage from Drought Grows in DPRK
articles.content:
Damage from Drought Grows in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Damage from a long spell of drought is growing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Crops have withered in the country's west coastal areas and water level has lowered in rivers and reservoirs, causing electricity shortage.
					
					 Livestock are suffering from lack of water.
					
					 The drought has severely affected more than 10 000 hectares of farmland in South Phyongan Province alone, 26 percent of cultivated land in Hoechang County and 770 hectares in Sukchon County. The same holds true for Phyongwon, Mundok, Nyongwon and other counties.
					
					 Corn has to be sowed again on hundreds of hectares, which needs more manpower, seeds and fuel. It is hard to expect in not a few fields the harvest of wheat and barley sown as earlier crops.
					
					 Meanwhile, 120 hectares of rain-dependent paddy fields are left unsown in Mundok County and 60 hectares in Taehung County, affected by the drought.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province, too, is plagued with the devastating drought.
					
					 According to data available, nearly 10 300 hectares of crops throughout the province have been damaged by the dry spell. Hit hardest are Chongdan, Kangryong and Ongjin counties.
					
					 All local people have turned out in the campaign to minimize drought damage.
					
					 Some days ago, Premier Choe Yong Rim toured the Chilgol Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang and the Ryongchon Co-op Farm in Hwangju County, North Hwanghae Province to acquaint himself with drought damage.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Outpourings
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Outpourings
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- South Korean traitor Lee Myung Bak was reported recently to have talked rubbish about the DPRK, labeling it "closed society" and vociferating about "a critical situation." He went the lengths of talking nonsense that "the north is sending a strongly worded message for its internal reasons."
					 Minju Joson on Saturday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 Lee's reckless remarks are nothing but sophism let loose by an idiot who knows nothing about what is going on in the world.
					
					 "Strongly worded message", "internal reasons" and the like touted by Lee are nothing but rhetoric intended to shift the responsibility for having brought to the north-south relations to a collapse and created a touch-and-go situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is widely known that the inter-Korean relations have rapidly deteriorated since Lee's seizure of power though they had favorably developed after the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration. The Lee group ran wild to do harm to compatriots in collusion with outside forces. Its moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen reached their height during the nation's mourning over the loss of its father. It went the lengths of daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, the life and soul of the nation.
					
					 Lee is sadly mistaken if he thinks he can go scot-free after committing such high treason. 
					
					 It is the steadfast will of all the Korean service personnel and people to wipe out the group of traitors who dared seriously insult the great men deeply respected not only by all Koreans but by the whole world.
					
					 Lee's reckless remarks are nothing but the shriek made by those more dead than alive, forsaken by the people for their totally bankrupt domestic and foreign policies and the ceaseless disclosure of their hideous scandals. They will only precipitate his doomsday, the commentary concludes.

articles.title: Leftovers of Cold War Should Be Removed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Leftovers of Cold War Should Be Removed: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The leftovers of the Cold War should be removed without fail in order to defuse the tension and ensure durable peace on the Korean Peninsula, put an end to national division and achieve the country's reunification.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The Korean nation can not get rid of the constant danger of war nor can it expect peace in Asia and the rest of the world without removing the Cold War leftovers from the peninsula, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. military presence in south Korea resulted in dividing into the north and the south the Korean nation that has lived as a homogenous nation on the same territory for thousands of years creating its own culture and history. It has also caused antagonism and confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					 The leftovers of the Cold War are a source of escalating tensions and danger of war in the peninsula and threatening peace and security of Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Only when they are removed from the peninsula, will it be possible to turn the region into a peace zone, stabilize the situation of Northeast Asia and create conditions and circumstances favorable for peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 After the end of the Cold War, different countries of the world have pushed forward development, getting reconciled and cooperating with each other, away from disputes and confrontation.
					
					 The main trend of the times is reconciliation, cooperation and development, not war and confrontation.
					
					 The countries concerned including the U.S. had better fulfill the responsibility and duty they have assumed in removing the Cold War leftovers from the peninsula, though belatedly, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Critical of U.S. Talk about "Threat from Iran"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Critical of U.S. Talk about "Threat from Iran"
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Western forces including the U.S. are busy with a noisy anti-Iran propaganda campaign these days. Lurking behind this is a sinister intention to calm down the mounting anti-U.S. sentiment and carry out their shaking strategy for dominating Mideast under the pretext of a fresh "threat from Iran."   
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The anti-U.S. sentiment is daily mounting in Mideast countries upon which it pins so big hope. 
					
					 The U.S. is working hard to divert the accusing finger pointed to it into Iran exercising a big influence in Mideast. That is why the U.S. began spreading the fiction about "threat from Iran" in a sinister bid to convert the anti-U.S. sentiment into an anti-Iran sentiment and put the whole of Mideast under its control, availing itself of the sentiment. 
					
					 It is also the calculation of the U.S. to justify its moves to build a missile shield in Europe.
					
					 The moves frantically stepped up by the U.S. under the pretext of coping with Iran's "threat of long-range ballistic missile" have come under strong fire in different countries. 
					
					 The story about fresh "threat from Iran" was concocted by the U.S. to serve the purpose of justifying them. 
					
					 But this old-fashioned propaganda of the U.S. is not workable in this bright world.
					
					 The above-said story is aimed, to all intents and purposes, at building missile shields in Europe and Mideast under the pretext of "threat from Iran" and thus maintain its military edge there. It is the real scenario of the U.S. to create conditions for forming a worldwide missile network by citing the "threat from Iran" in an effort to reinforce its hegemonic position as the "world's only superpower".

articles.title: Koreans in China Call for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Koreans in China Call for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China held a meeting to pledge to struggle to implement the June 15 joint declaration on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of its publication.
					 The meeting was attended by officials of the Yanbian regional association of the General Association of Koreans in China and its branches and the Yanbian regional youth committee of the Youth Federation of Koreans in China in Jilin Province of China on June 16. 
					
					 The declaration was read out there first.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers said that after the publication of the joint declaration all Koreans in the north, the south and overseas have strenuously carried on the movement for national reunification while achieving the national reconciliation and unity under the uplifted banner of "By the Korean nation itself".
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea, however, spoiled all the achievements made in the past by the Korean nation and totally negated the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and screwed up the military tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 They appealed to all the Koreans to rise as one in unity in the struggle to make a clean sweep of the Lee group to the last man as early as possible and bring back the June 15 era.
					
					 They also called upon all Koreans in China to vigorously struggle under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration with the conviction that Korea is sure to be reunified under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and thus thoroughly carry out the behests of leader Kim Jong Il for national reunification.

articles.title: Koreans in Kazakhstan Call for Stronger Patriotic Movement for Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in Kazakhstan Call for Stronger Patriotic Movement for Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Kang Sun Ho, chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kazakhstan, issued a statement on June 17 in support of an appeal to the Koreans at home and abroad issued on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 The statement said that the confederation and Koreans in Kazakhstan voice full support and solidarity with the appeal made by the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to all Koreans at home and abroad to closely unite under the banner of the declaration to give steady continuity to the trend of the June 15 era of reunification this year without fail and make a breakthrough in independent reunification.
					
					 It was thanks to the June 15 joint declaration, the banner of national reunification, that the Koreans could put an end to the distress-torn history in which they experienced national ruin and suffered from a war and division in the last century, and usher in a new era of national reconciliation and unity, peace and reunification, it said, and went on:
					
					 However, the present south Korean conservative authorities' frantic anti-DPRK smear campaign and vicious moves to escalate confrontation drove the north-south relations into the worst phase, totally suspended visits and contact and barred meetings for reunification common to the nation from taking place for several years. 
					
					 We will thoroughly shatter the ultra-right conservative group's moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen and wage a more dynamic patriotic movement for reunification, closely united under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at C.C., WPK Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at C.C., WPK Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 They included a seminar on Kim Jong Il's exploits, a photo exhibition and a film show in Bangladesh, a film show in Indonesia, a ceremony of opening a book, photo and handicraft exhibition in Bulgaria and a lecture in Guinea between June 9 and 15.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were books and photos showing immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and the achievements made in the DPRK and art works indicative of the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The participants in the film shows watched "Pyongyang at Night" and other Korean films.
					
					 The chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy and other speakers said at the events that Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea, the Songun idea, founded by President Kim Il Sung into the guiding idea in the era of independence through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 They recalled that Kim Jong Il bolstered the military capability of the country in every way and the DPRK achieved a harmonious whole of the leader, the party and the people, something unprecedented in the world history of politics, under his wise leadership.
					
					 The victorious advance of the Workers' Party of Korea having the dear respected Kim Jong Un at its top post will go on and the DPRK has a rosy future, they noted.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Guinean Association of Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia recalled that Kim Jong Il unrolled a far-reaching plan of building a thriving socialist country and energetically led the army and people of the DPRK to fulfill it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Bangladeshi Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Bangladeshi Paper
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi paper Blits on June 6 carried the detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche".
					 The work, published on April 6, 2012, clarifies the idea that it is a principled requirement for the victorious advance of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into a glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Lauded by Ecuadorian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Lauded by Ecuadorian Organization
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" is a historic work fully reflecting the strong sense of revolutionary moral obligation, said the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People in a statement on June 14. 
					 The statement noted that the work fully reflects the indomitable will of Kim Jong Un to invariably inherit the ideas and feats of the preceding leaders. The important work indicates how to uphold the leader of revolution, it said, and went on:
					
					 It was thanks to the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il that the DPRK could firmly protect the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 They were the great leaders recognized by the world and their feats for the eternal prosperity of the DPRK and the human cause of independence are immortal.
					
					 The world progressive people are convinced that the Korean people will surely emerge victorious in the struggle to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche and reunify the country independently under the tested leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Foreign Organizations' Websites
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Foreign Organizations' Websites
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on their websites respectively on June 11 and 14 the full text of the congratulatory speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at a joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday.
					 Kim Jong Un, in his speech on June 6, 2012, expressed his steadfast will to invariably carry forward Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's noble outlook on future and the younger generation. He also indicated the tasks and ways for bringing up the KCU members as reserve forces, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, who will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website the work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People".
					
					 The work, published on April 20, 2012, clarifies the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the revolutionary cause in their lifetime.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks for firmly upholding and preserving the ideas and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and glorifying them for all ages.

articles.title: June 15 Joint Declaration Praised
articles.content:
June 15 Joint Declaration Praised
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Public figures of Guinea and Nepal issued statements on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a statement on June 12 said that the joint declaration is a cornerstone for the development of inter-Korean relations and a great programme for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The idea of "By the Korean nation itself", the basic spirit of the joint declaration, still serves as an ever-lasting banner for Korea's reunification as it reflects the spirit of national independence and provides a basic guarantee for defending peace, he noted.
					
					 He urged the south Korean "government" authorities to opt for the reconciliation, unity and reunification of the Korean nation by getting rid of dependence on foreign forces and extreme confrontation with compatriots at an early date.
					
					 The Korean people will surely achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, the cherished desire of the nation, under the banner of the joint declaration as they have the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the helm of the revolution, he stressed.
					
					 Phanindra Raj Pant, co-secretary general of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal who is secretary general of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, in a statement on June 10 demanded the south Korean authorities sincerely implement the joint declaration, force the U.S. forces withdraw from south Korea and stop at once all forms of military exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 He urged them to refrain from obstructing the struggle of all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 He extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle to build a peaceful and prospering socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Lauded in Uganda, Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Lauded in Uganda, Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Personages of Uganda and the Czech Republic praised leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un and expressed full support for the Korean people's cause when having conversations with DPRK ambassadors to their countries recently.
					 Hyuha Samali Dorothy, deputy secretary general of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, said Kim Jong Il strengthened the Workers' Party of Korea into a revolutionary party, a mother party serving the popular masses and an invincible party with strong discipline.
					
					 Watching TV conveying the news of the grand celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union in the presence of Kim Jong Un, the deputy secretary general said, he keenly realized how greatly Kim Jong Un values the future of revolution. 
					
					 The future of the DPRK is in safe hands, he said. 
					
					 He denounced the south Korean "government" authorities for denying the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and aggravating the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 He urged them to stop disturbing the regional peace and stability. 
					
					 Jaromir Slapota, chairman of the Foreign Relations Association of Czechoslovakia, said that the DPRK's access to nuclear deterrent by its own efforts and with indigenous technology proves that it has tremendous potential. He reiterated his will to widely introduce the true picture of the DPRK to the Czech public in the future.

articles.title: Koreans Will Certainly Build Thriving Nation: Trinidad and Tobago President
articles.content:
Koreans Will Certainly Build Thriving Nation: Trinidad and Tobago President
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- George Maxwell Richard, president of Trinidad and Tobago, received credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Jon Yong Jin on June 6.
					 The president expressed satisfaction over the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 He expressed conviction that the Korean people would certainly realize the idea of building a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission.
					
					 He hoped Korea would be reunified independently and peacefully without interference of foreign forces.

articles.title: Persiste sequia en provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
articles.content:
Persiste sequia en provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- Se expanden en la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, principal granero, los danos causados por la persistente sequia.
					Segun los datos recogidos, hasta el dia 23, se agrietan casi 20 mil hectareas de la tierra cultivable y las plantas agricolas siguen marchitandose.
					
					Particularmente, el distrito de Hwangju, encargado de mucha porcion en la produccion de cereales de la provincia, sufre graves danos.
					
					La abuela Hwang Po Son (69 anos de edad), moradora de la comuna de Koyon, dijo al reportero de la ACNC que la presente sequia es la primera durante su vida.
					
					Ri Sun Bom (44 anos de edad), presidente del comite de gestion de granjas cooperativas del distrito, senalo que el distrito se encuentra en un estado de no esperar la cosecha estable aunque se realizo 3 veces la resiembra en mas de 2 mil hectareas de maizales a escala distrital.
					
					Pak Tok Gwan (56 anos de edad), presidente de la junta administrativa de la granja cooperativa de Ryongchon dijo que el largo de canas de maiz  mide entre 40-70cm frente a la normal 1-1.50m.
					
					Paek Yong Chol (42 anos de edad), presidente de la junta administrativa de la granja de Koyon, destaco que en caso de seguir la sequia se vera obligado a cortar los maices y sembrar de nuevo otros cultivos.
					
					Debido a la desecacion de embalses, en algunos semilleros no se realiza todavia la trasplantacion de arroz.  
					
					Tal situacion agrava mas el aseguramiento estable de provisiones de los habitantes.
					
					En la actualidad se despliega la labor para reducir los danos de la sequia bajo el activo apoyo de los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los funcionarios de ministerios y organos centrales y otros habitantes de diversos estratos.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia peroracion anti-RPDC de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia peroracion anti-RPDC de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak acuso a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de "sociedad bloqueada" y la "coyuntura peligrosa". Ademas, hablo de que "la palabra intransigente del Norte se debe a la situacion interna".
					Tales palabras de Lee son sofismas de un imbecil que no sabe nada del mundo.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este sabado y continua:
					
					Los disparates del traidor Lee no pasan de ser mentiras para imputar a otro la responsabilidad de la ruptura de las relaciones intercoreanas y el peligro de guerra creada en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Tan pronto como tomo el poder, el traidor Lee llevo a la ruptura las relaciones intercoreanas que se desarrollaban favorablemente despues de la aprobacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio.
					
					La banda del traidor Lee perpetro en el periodo del gran duelo nacional maniobras de confrontacion fratricida y atento hasta la maxima dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					Esta totalmente equivocado si el traidor Lee piensa en que estaria salvo con tal conducta.
					
					Es firme la voluntad de todo el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC de aniquilar a la banda de traidores que calumnia atrevidamente a los grandes hombres sin pares a quienes admiran toda la nacion coreana y el mundo.
					
					El disparate de Lee deviene una fanfarronada de un cadaver vivo que perdio el apoyo de los habitantes por el fracaso total de la politica interna y externa y los tremendos casos irregulares y corruptos, lo que adelantara solo la ruina del traidor Lee.

articles.title: Hay que eliminar en Corea restos de guerra fria, insiste Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Hay que eliminar en Corea restos de guerra fria, insiste Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que es necesario eliminar los restos de la epoca de la guerra fria para aflojar la tension, asegurar la paz duradera, acabar con la division de la nacion y lograr la reunificacion del pais en la Peninsula Coreana, y continua:
					Sin esto, la nacion coreana no podra liberarse del permanente peligro de la guerra ni garantizar la paz de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					Debido a la ocupacion militar de las tropas norteamericanas sobre el territorio surcoreano, la nacion coreana que vino creando durante miles de anos la larga cultura y la historia con la misma sangre sobre el mismo territorio, se ha dividido en dos partes y creado el antagonismo y la confrontacion entre el Norte y el Sur.
					
					Los restos de la guerra fria son la causa que crea en la Peninsula Coreana la tension y el peligro de guerra y amenaza la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo.
					
					Cuando se eliminen en esta Peninsula tales restos, podra convertirse esta zona en la de paz libre del peligro de guerra y asegurarse las condiciones y ambientes favorables a estabilizar la situacion del Nordeste Asiatico y asegurar la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					Despues del fin de la guerra fria, en la palestra internacional varios paises se liberaron de conflictos y confrontaciones y aceleran el desarrollo promoviendo la reconciliacion y la cooperacion.
					
					La reconciliacion, la cooperacion y el desarrollo sirven de la corriente fundamental de la epoca.
					
					EE.UU. y otros paises concernidos deben realizar ahora mismo sus responsabilidades y deberes en eliminar los restos de la epoca de la guerra fria existentes en la Peninsula Coreana.
